results.firPara: André Villas-Boas has been appointed coach of Chinese Super League side Shanghai SIPG on a reported salary of £11m a year.
results.secPara: The former Chelsea and Tottenham manager replaces Sven-Goran Eriksson following the Swedes sacking. It is his first job since leaving Zenit St Petersburg in May.
results.webTitle: André Villas-Boas confirmed as Shanghai SIPG’s new manager

results.firPara: Burnley will want to build on their draw at Old Trafford with a home win over Palace and Middlesbrough cannot be relishing a trip to Barça-beaters Man City
results.secPara: Since that exhilarating victory over Manchester City, Spurs have gone six games without a win and their performance in Wednesdays defeat by Bayer Leverkusen at Wembley amounted to a bottle job of England-v-Iceland proportions, with several of the same culprits plus some character masquerading as a £30m midfielder. The north London derby offers a chance for rapid redemption but if Spurs players cannot get their heads sufficiently together to pass to each other and track runners, at least, then Mauricio Pochettinos embarrassment is about to get an awful lot deeper. PD
results.webTitle: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend

results.firPara: The stars return to MLS is a great story but what does it say about the strength of the league that he has been able to slot back in so easily?
results.secPara: The stars return to MLS is a great story but what does it say about the strength of the league that he has been able to slot back in so easily?
results.webTitle: The downside of Landon Donovan's LA Galaxy comeback

results.firPara: This mornings fluff is coming back from the wilderness

results.firPara: Michael Edwards is to be appointed Liverpools first sporting director, a position that will see him take the lead role in transfer negotiations at Anfield.
results.secPara: Edwards has impressed Liverpools owner, Fenway Sports Group, in a variety of roles since bring brought to the club from Tottenham Hotspur in 2011 by the former director of football Damien Comolli.
results.webTitle: Liverpool promote Michael Edwards to sporting director role

results.firPara: Southampton came from behind to record a deserved victory over a managerless and out-of-sorts Internazionale, despite missing a first-half penalty
results.secPara: Heres our match report from St Marys. Bye!
results.webTitle: Southampton 2-1 Internazionale: Europa League – as it happened

results.firPara: For Southampton, nights like this against one of European footballs heavyweights will live long in the memory, after coming from behind to beat Internazionale on home turf. Yet it was another grim outing for the Italians, who sit bottom of the group and languish 12th in Serie A.
results.secPara: Six years ago this week Southampton supporters walked to St Marys for the visit of Dagenham & Redbridge in League One. In 2010, Inter did the double, lifting the Champions League and winning Serie A under José Mourinho. A Virgil van Dijk equaliser and a Yuto Nagatomo own goal later and those days in the third tier provided some incredible context.
results.webTitle: Southampton sink Inter thanks to Yuto Nagatomo own goal

results.firPara: • Mourinho furious at lack of effort in 2-1 defeat at Fenerbahce
results.secPara: José Mourinho accused his Manchester United players of lacking commitment and said they deserved to lose against Fenerbahce for treating Thursdays Europa League group game as a summer friendly.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho lets rip at Manchester United’s ‘summer friendly’ attitude

results.firPara: This was a slipshod and frantic display that confirms Manchester United remain a confused bunch under José Mourinho.Paul Pogba limped off before the half hour but that may have been a blessing owing to his underwhelming contribution since his world-record transfer in the summer. The Frenchmans replacement, Zlatan Ibrahimovic, had a match to forget, again looking off the pace and in need of next weeks international break.
results.secPara: He is not the only United player who appears lost. The defence were constantly overrun – perhaps because the midfield went awol – and though Anthony Martial and Marcus Rashford showed flashes of quality, Wayne Rooney was virtually anonymous until an 89th-minute consolation that is goal No247 for the club.
results.webTitle: Manchester United beaten by stunning strikes from Fenerbahce’s Sow and Lens

results.firPara: Mourinho is putting the blame squarely on the players I think they deserved to win. Football is not just about quality, its also about effort, commitment, playing to the limits and giving everything. A team that concedes a goal after two minutes is a team that is not ready, not prepared, not concentrated .. its our fault. After their second goal we had a reaction but we didnt deserve more because football is 90 minutes and it is to be played at the maximum of your desire, concentration and capacity ... At the start it was like they were playing the Champions League final and we were playing a sumer friendly. Thats the reality.
results.secPara: Im a City fan but I would not wish this on my worst enemy, says William Corkhill. United players are just not interested. Its kind of depressing. I cant believe Im saying this.
results.webTitle: Fenerbahce v Manchester United: Europa League – as it happened
